Legislative History of Laws

Uniform Law

This section is based upon § 3 of the Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (1999 Act). See 7A, Pt. I, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE § 28-4902

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Except as otherwise provided in subsection (b) of this section, this chapter applies to electronic records and electronic signatures relating to a transaction.
This chapter does not apply to a transaction to the extent it is governed by:
A law governing the creation and execution of wills, codicils, or testamentary trusts; or
Subtitle I of this title, except for §§ 28:1-107 and 28:1-206 and Articles 2 and 2A.

This chapter applies to an electronic record or electronic signature otherwise excluded from the application of this chapter under subsection (b) of this section to the extent it is governed by a law other than those specified in subsection (b) of this section.
A transaction subject to this chapter is also subject to other applicable substantive law.
